title: Trump goes after Nancy Pelosi and Adam Schiff in remarks at Values Voter Summit
text:
President Donald Trump has renewed his counter-attack on House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Intelligence Chairman Adam Schiff, saying the top Democrats are the ones who should be impeached.

Trump's remarks came in a speech on Saturday night at the Values Voter Summit at the Omni Shoreham Hotel in Washington DC.

'Our shared values are under assault like never before. Extreme left-wing radicals, both inside and outside government, are determined to shred our constitution and eradicated the beliefs we all cherish,' Trump said.

Trump reiterated his criticism against Schiff and Pelosi, saying: 'Maybe we just impeach them because they are lying. What they are doing is a terrible thing to our country.'

Trump's remarks came in a speech on Saturday night at the Values Voter Summit at the Omni Shoreham Hotel in Washington DC

Trump said he's 'going to take a look' at suing Schiff over the false and exaggerated version of Trump's controversial Ukraine phone call that the Democrat recited at a committee hearing.

'He has to pay a big price.' Trump said. 'We are going after these people.'

Trump said that his lawyers told him that Schiff had 'immunity' for his statements, but that he still planned to sue the Congressman.

'They can't mean immunity for that. I said sue them anyway — even if we lose the American public will understand,' Trump said.

Trump devoted several minutes of his remarks to Schiff, impersonating the Congressman and commenting that 'he has a very narrow neck.'

'You would not be impressed with him physically,' Trump added.

Trump called Schiff 'crooked as hell' and defended his own 'perfect' phone call in which he asked the president of Ukraine to investigate his political rival Joe Biden.

Trump renewed his counter-attack on House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Intelligence Chairman Adam Schiff, saying the top Democrats are the ones who should be impeached

Pastor Andrew Brunson delivered the opening prayers before Trump spoke.

Brunson spent two years as a political prisoner in Turkey before he was freed last year after the Trump administration intervened.

Speaking to the conservative Christian audience, Trump took the opportunity to defend his decision to pull American troops out out Syria. The decision that has been criticized by evangelical U.S. voters who are allied with Israel.

Critics say that the troop drawdown will leave ethnic Kurds vulnerable to Turkey, which has already begun a military incursion into norther Syria.

'Don't forget they are fighting for their land. They haven't helped us fighting for our land,' Trump said of the Kurds.

'Let them have their borders, but I don't think our soldiers should be there for the next 50 years guarding a border between Turkey and Syria when we can't guard our own borders,' he said.

Pastor Andrew Brunson (right) delivered the opening prayers before Trump spoke

Audience members pray before Trump delivers remarks at Values Voter Summit at the Omni Shoreham Hotel in Washington, DC on Saturday

Trump said that U.S. troops were supposed to be supposed to be in Syria for '30 days' but would be there '10 years' if they weren't pulled out.

'These wars they never end,' he said.

Trump talked about how tough it is to call the families of fallen soldiers, and to go to Dover Air Force Base to meet their returning coffins.

'It's the hardest thing I have to do,' Trump said. 'You would hear screams and cries like you've never heard before,' he said of coffins coming home.

'We've been in these wars now — one of them 19 years — they didn't fight to win.'
description: Trump's remarks came in a speech on Saturday night at the Values Voter Summit at the Omni Shoreham Hotel in Washington DC.
